title: Online Flipped Inpatient Clerkship: 5E Model-Based Practical Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: A course designed for in-service professionals to effectively perform patient clerkship in a non-face-to-face educational environment considering the COVID-19 pandemic, emphasizing self-directed learning using digital devices and practical task performance.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and propose improvements for inpatient medication treatment plans following the 5E Model (Engagement-Exploration-Explanation-Elaboration-Evaluation).
Learners can explain at least three real-world applications of a pharmacist’s role in patient case studies through online content and asynchronous discussions.

Learners collaborate at least twice in multidisciplinary teams (doctor, engineer, administrator roles) within virtual scenario-based role-plays (three scenarios in medical/engineering fields) and practice/evaluate strategies meeting at least four of five predefined communication checklist items (clear goal communication, active listening, conflict resolution).

resources: LMS Platform (Video, Quiz, Discussion Board Features)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
